bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of Document.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: No.297. Docket 9
United States District Court, District of Nebraska
The United States vs. In matter of Habeas Corpus of "Till"
Silias Robbnis Benji. S. Baker U.S Attorney
Omaha Reublican Print.
In the United States
DONT FORGET: Finish this page and split the doccuments into their own files

To Honorable Judge of the District Court of the United States for the District of Nebraska: Your peitioner, M.O. Ricketts, a citizen of the State of Nebraska, on behalf of "Till" a colored boy of the age of about 18 years respectfully represents unto your Honor that the said Till is now unlawfully and wrongfully restrained of his liberty and held as a slave by Milton WIllerford of and at Fillmore County in the state of Nebraska in violation of the Thriteenth Amendment to the constitution of the United States of America; that the said Milton Willerford clairms to have purchased the said TIill either in Kentucky or Missouri where he formerly lived and brough the said poy Till to Fillmore County, Nebraska, some seven or eight years ago, clairming then to be the owner of him as his slave, and ever since then he has claimed to own the said boy Till as as his slave at said Fillmore County, and during all this time has treated him cruelly and in an inhumane manner, depriving him of all liberty and the ordinary comforts of life. And your petitioner shows that the said Till is not held under or by virtue of any process of any court of the United States or of any state, and that he is not held for any crime comitted in violation of any law of the United States or of any state.

And your petitioner futher shows that the said Till, by reason of his being long held in slavery by the said Milton Willerford and the treatment he has recieved, is unable to read or write, or to fully understand his situation and condition, and by reason thereof, this petition is presented in his behalf by your peititoner M. O. Ricketts, aforesaid.

Wherefore, your petitioner prays that your Honor issue the Writ of Habeas Corpus directing and commanding the Marshall of said district to bring the body of the said "Till" before your Honor and to summon the said Milton Willerford to appear and state the cause of his detaining the said "Till" and that the said "Till" may be discharged from the custody of the said Milton Willerford and set free to go where he will and for full relief in the premises.
State of Nebraska, Douglas County. } ss.
M. O. Ricketts being first duly sworn, on oath, says he has read the above and foregoing peititon and knows the contents thereof, and the same are true as he believes.
M. O. Ricketts M.D
Subscribed in my presence and sworn to before me
Silas Robbins
Notary Public Douglas County, Neb.
In the US. District Court, District of Nebraska 2978
See the matter of the Habeas Corpus of "Till" vs Milton Willerford
Return to wit and answer
Filed Nov. 11 1890 E.S.Gurresh Clerk
L.N.Fackey atty for respondent Willerford.
In the United States Court Disctrict of Nebraska
In Re "Till", matter of the application of M. O. Reicketts for the writ of Habeas Corpus against Milton Willerford
Return to writ and answer
And now comes its said Milton Willerford according with command of said writ and produces at court the body of said "Till" who has been in his custody for the past seven years and says

That he has never purchased or claimed to have purchased said boy "Till" and has never claimed to own him as a slave or otherwise; that on his contrary said "Till" has lived with his as a member of his family during said time of his own free will, and now resides as a member of Willerford's family of his own will.
That Milford has never abused or ill treated said boy in any manner and has never deprived him of his liberty
and the respondent Milton Willerford denies each and every other allegation in the petition contained accepting such written as are herein admitted to be true
Wherefore respondent prays that the action may be dismissed and sealed he recovers his costs
Milton Willerford respondent by L.N.Facky his attorney
State of Nebraska, Doughlas County } ss.
L.N.Facky bring fully that he is attorney for respondent herein and that the fact and allegation in the and aneww and this as his family herein.
L.N.Facky
Clerk
In the District Court of the United States For the District of Nebraska

To Milton Willerford:- You are hereby commanded to have the body of "Till" by you unlawfully detained and held from his liberty as is alleged together with the cause of his detention and hodling by you, before Honorable E.S. Dundy, Judge of the United States District Court House and Post Office Building in the City of Omaha, In the State of Nebraska on or before the expiration of twenty days after you acceptthe close of this Writ
Then and there to be dealt with according to Law, and have you then and there this Writ with the cause of detention etc.
Witness the Honorable E.S.Dundy Judge of the United States District Court for the District of Nebraska and the Seal of said Court affixed hereto this 22nd., day of October A.D 1890
Elnor S. Dundy
To the United States marshal, for the District of Nebraska, you will make proper served and due returns writ without unecessary delay. Elnor S. Dundy, Judge

District of Nebraska, ss. I heveby certify and return that on the 23 day of oct 1890 I recieved this order and on the 23 day of oct 1890 I served the same upon the within named Milton Willerford in Sabins County, State and District of Nebraska, by delievering to and leaving with him and original a certified copythereof with all the endorsements thereon. B.D. Faughter, United states Marshal for the District of Nebraska by N.B. Nehellen
